columns.text: In this problem, we need to look at how a loan can affect the decision of going to either business school.

Here, we will solve or the present value of the interest when he loans for a tuition for business school. We need to recall that the interest can be solved using the formula for compound interest:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Interest}&=\text{Principal}\times((1+\text{Rate})^\text{Time}-1)
\end{aligned}$$

For Wilton University, since it will take two years, the interest will be:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Interest}&=\$58,000 \times ((1+0.054)^2-1)\\[15 pt]
&=\$6,433.13
\end{aligned}$$

The interest when taking a loan for Wilton University is $\$6,433.13$

For Mount Perry College, since it will only take one year, then the interest will be:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Interest}&=\$75,000 \times ((1+0.054)^1-1)\\[15 pt]
&=\$4,050.00
\end{aligned}$$

The interest when taking a loan for Mount Perry College is $\$4,050.00$

For the present value of interest for Wilton University, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value of interest}&=\dfrac{\$6,433.13}{1+0.055}\\[15 pt]
&=\$6,097.75
\end{aligned}$$

For Mount Perry College:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value of interest}&=\dfrac{\$4,050.00}{1+0.055}\\[15 pt]
&=\$3,838.86
\end{aligned}$$

Now we can subtract these from the present value of each school where we will get the final values of:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value of Wilton University}&=\$1,612,050.35-\$6,097.75\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,605,952.60
\end{aligned}$$

The present value for Wilton University is $\$1,605,952.60$

For Mount Perry College:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value of Mount Perry College}&=\$1,489,334.71-\$4,050\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,485,284.71
\end{aligned}$$

The present value for Mount Perry College is $\$1,485,284.71$
As we can see, despite taking loans, the present value for both schools remain high and Wilton University is still the best choice.
